{{Wireless embedded system |brand=3Com |model=3CRWE454A72 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=12/19/2003 |manuf_country=Taiwan |manuf=Arcadyan |manuf_model=WA6001A-32 |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=access point |fcc_id=RAXWA6001AARC |ic_id=4711A-WA6001AA |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR5312A |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR5312A |wi1_chip2_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip2_model=AR5112 |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=a |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi2_chip1_model=AR5312A |wi2_chip2_brand=Atheros |wi2_chip2_model=AR2112 |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=Altima |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user= |default_pass=admin |oui=00:12:A9 |oui_eth=00:12:A9 |default_ch= }} ''3Com OfficeConnect Wireless 11a/b/g Access Point''
[http://download.modem-help.co.uk/mfcs-U/USR/3CRWE454A72/ Downloads (User's Guide and Firmware) on m-h]
An '''Arcadyan''' P/N and "MADE IN TAIWAN" appears to be silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
'''3Com''''s manual shows the default SSID as being '''3Com''' for both bands.
